name: Hainanese Chicken Rice
short_description: Steamed chicken, tender and succulent, is served with fragrant rice infused with chicken broth, drizzled in soy sauce and sesame oil. A beloved staple, this dish reflects Singapore's rich culinary heritage.

name: Laksa
short_description: Rich and spicy, this beloved noodle soup hails from Singapore, blending Chinese and Malay influences. Creamy coconut milk mingles with robust spices, creating a fragrant bowl that warms the soul.

name: Char kway teow
short_description: Savor the smoky, stir-fried delight of flat rice noodles, plump shrimps, and tender cockles in char kway teow, a beloved street food from Singapore and Malaysia. Each bite bursts with umami, enhanced by a touch of soy sauce and the crunch of bean sprouts.

name: Curry Laksa
short_description: A vibrant blend of Indian, Chinese, and Southeast Asian influences, this spicy noodle soup features silky noodles swimming in rich coconut milk, complemented by tender prawns and tofu. Aromatic galangal adds a fragrant kick, making every slurp a delicious adventure.

name: Duck rice
short_description: Savor the rich flavors of Singaporean duck rice, where tender roasted or braised duck meets fragrant white rice. Infused with aromatic spices like cinnamon and ginger, each bite is a delicious homage to local culinary heritage.

name: Chilli crab
short_description: Originating as a beloved street food, this vibrant stir-fry features succulent crab simmered in a spicy blend of shallots, ginger, and fiery hot peppers, creating a mouthwatering, tangy sauce.

name: Roti prata
short_description: Crispy on the outside and fluffy within, this ghee-kissed flatbread hails from Singapore's vibrant food scene. It's perfectly paired with rich mutton curry or savory fish dishes for an unforgettable meal.
most_iconic_place: Mr and Mrs Mohgan's Super Crispy Roti Prata

name: Fish Head Curry
short_description: A vibrant Singaporean specialty, this fish head curry combines tender fish heads simmered in a rich coconut cream broth, infused with tangy tamarind, aromatic garlic, and fragrant curry leaves. Each spoonful bursts with bold flavors, celebrating the country’s multicultural culinary heritage.

name: Yusheng
short_description: Celebrated during Chinese New Year, this vibrant salad layers fresh salmon with crunchy taro, carrot, and cucumber, all tossed with zesty ginger and flavorful toppings for a festive, uplifting experience.

name: Kaya Toast
short_description: Toasted to perfection, two slices of bread cradle a sweet kaya spread, bursting with rich coconut and fragrant pandan flavors. A beloved breakfast staple in Singapore, it’s a must-try treat!

name: Hokkien mee
short_description: Originating from the Fujian province of China, Hokkien mee features a tantalizing stir-fry of round wheat noodles and thin rice noodles, enriched with prawns, eggs, and succulent pork. Each bite bursts with savory flavors, complemented by crunchy bean sprouts for a delightful texture.

name: Bak kut teh
short_description: Originating from Chinese culinary traditions, this fragrant pork soup simmers with garlic, star anise, and cinnamon, creating a rich, hearty broth filled with tender meat and earthy mushrooms.

name: Braised Duck Rice
short_description: Tender roasted duck glistens over fragrant rice or yam rice, drenched in a savory soy sauce. Accompanied by braised eggs, tofu, and gizzards, it’s a beloved Singaporean comfort dish steeped in culinary tradition.

name: Pao fan
short_description: Originating from the Teochew community, this comforting soup features rice soaked in a rich, savory broth, often brimming with fresh seafood, tender meats, and vibrant vegetables. Each spoonful bursts with umami, making it a beloved culinary tradition in Singapore.

name: Kway chap
short_description: Flat rice sheets soak up a rich soy sauce broth, complemented by tender offal, savory pork belly, and spiced with cinnamon and cloves. A beloved Singaporean comfort dish, it celebrates the art of slow cooking and bold flavors.
most_iconic_place: Jin Ji Teochew Braised Duck and Kway Chap

name: Black Pepper Crab
short_description: Hailing from Singapore, the iconic black pepper crab tantalizes with its bold flavors, featuring succulent crab stir-fried in a fragrant mix of black pepper, garlic, and oyster sauce. A sizzling treat not often found at home!

name: Roasted Duck Rice
short_description: Tender, succulent roasted duck glistens over fragrant rice in this beloved Singaporean dish. Accompanied by rich sauces and savory extras like braised eggs and tofu, it's a flavorful feast for the senses.

name: Roti John
short_description: A beloved Singaporean street food, this savory sandwich features a fluffy French loaf filled with a rich blend of beaten eggs, minced meat, and aromatic spices, grilled to golden perfection.

name: Katong laksa
short_description: Originating from Singapore's vibrant Katong neighborhood, this seafood soup features noodles swimming in a rich, spicy shrimp broth infused with creamy coconut milk and aromatic galangal. Each slurp delivers a burst of delightful flavors.

name: Har cheong gai
short_description: Originating from Singapore, succulent chicken wings are marinated in flavorful shrimp paste, then coated in a crispy batter of eggs, flour, and starch. Each bite delivers a delightful umami punch!

name: Cereal Prawns
short_description: Crispy fried prawns bathed in a buttery blend of toasted cereals, vibrant curry leaves, and a hint of chili create a beloved Singaporean delight, perfect for seafood enthusiasts.

name: Chai tow kway
short_description: Savory and satisfying, this Teochew-inspired stir-fry features crispy daikon radish cakes enhanced with eggs and fragrant chai poh. A beloved street food in Singapore, it's a delightful treat bursting with umami flavors.

name: Fresh spring roll (Popiah)
short_description: Delicate crepe-like wrappers cradle a vibrant mix of fresh vegetables, herbs, and savory proteins in this beloved Singaporean delight. Enjoy a burst of flavors in every bite, celebrating tradition and freshness.

name: Sambal Stingray
short_description: Grilled to perfection, tender stingray is slathered in a fiery sambal paste, blending chili, lime, and shrimp for a bold, mouthwatering experience. A beloved street food staple, it's a taste of Singapore's vibrant culinary heritage.
